page.title: 07LOCAL HISTORY-LT.GADDESDEN
page.content: The earliest part of the Bridgewater Arms,dates back to the 18th century. Towards the end of the century the Garret family,later to become the managers of the inn,were farmers on a site near there. The pub's first use was as a caoching inn and a school.It was like a village hall.In 1838 the Garrets were managers of the inn.When the house was made into an inn it was during or before the lifetime of the 7th Earl of Bridgewater. Now the pub sells food and has private flats at the top.The sign shows a ducal coronet. The Bridgewater Monument,built in memory of the 7th Earl of Bridgewater's wife,stands in Ashridge woods.It was built in 1832 and has 172 steps.
